column4: Ok, I have a gateway ml3109. If you send me a forum about it, ive read it. I am having problems with my sound, i can't get it to install the drivers. The "instructions" that come with the patch aren't instructions, its a list of commands. When i put the commands in to install the driver, it comes up "no such directory exists" i have a file named "alsa" and subfiles on my desktop. I am following the instructions on the forum, but they are
they just don't make sense

you guys are fucking useless. you tell me to explain what is going on, so i explain. then you don't answer me. omfg
jesus christ, everyone that is talking to me is trying to help me, so they tell me to explain. then i explain, then they don't fucking answer
im a newb, i don't know what im doing...i was being polite at first, but the people that were trying to help me all of a sudden quit
i have been
im sorry for my language
Where are these instructions you followed?
if it says it can't find the directory, it's possible that you need to switch to that directory first.
According to the instructions, you downloaded a file called "alsa-driver-1.0.15rc1.tar.gz", no?
Where did you put it?
If you just used Firefox to download it, then it probably saved to your desktop.
cd ~/Desktop/alsa
Sorry, you're still having problems? What does it say now?
One command at a time. It tells you that "tar" isn't a valid command, first of all?
Well, in some cases, the mixer starts out muted. Also, in my case, I needed to enable an option called "External Amplifier" to get sound on my laptop.
Since I don't know which sound card model you have, I can't guarantee that you would have the same settings.  But for me, it's in the sound mixer.
Okay, you did say you've seen all the forum stuff on this problem, but this thread mentions the External Amplifier option: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=276343
The external amplifier option isn't there for me
